snippet: The Manny Cantor Center in Lower Manhattan offers gym membership and classes along a sliding scale to reach residents of all income levels, a goal that seems almost mythic in nature.
abstract: Ginia Bellafante Big City column applauds Manny Cantor Center on East Broadway in Lower Manhattan, community and fitness center that welcomes both poor residents of nearby projects and well-off tenants of new condominiums, charging them on sliding scale; says center, which has undergone $55 million renovation, is rarity in that it counters economic segregation and fosters real interaction between New York's classes.
lead_paragraph: The Manny Cantor Center in Lower Manhattan offers gym membership and classes along a sliding scale to reach residents of all income levels, a goal that seems almost mythic in nature.

headline.main: A Community Center as DMZ in City’s Class War
headline.print_headline: In Class War, Establishing a DMZ
